channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Building waste dumped on the street Sidney Road n22. Opposite 59 Sidney Road, 6th September
item.description:
Cinder blocks, bricks and wooden pallet dumped at the garages on Sidney Road N22. Dangerous and I’m sick of people dumping here

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Sidney Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole roads need weeding, 6th September
item.description:
Brookdene Road, Blithdale Road, Bannockburn Road, Benares Road, St Nicholas Road, Kasghar Road, have not been swept in months. The weeds are really long, the gully’s are blocked. There’s one broken tree branch hanging down which is an accident waiting to happen. There’s leaves and rubbish everywhere on the pavement and roads. Please can you employ someone to tidy/ sweep our streets they are in a terrible state.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benares Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road gully blocked, 6th September
item.description:
Road side fully blocked with leaves as road hasn’t been cleaned or swept for months. Water is building up and flooding the footpath. Gully on the junction between churchmanorway and Benares Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benares Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent safety concern – Zebra crossing on Queensbridge Road near St Saviours Priory, 6th September
item.description:
I am writing to raise a serious safety concern regarding the zebra crossing on Queensbridge Road, near St Saviours Priory. On a daily basis, multiple drivers fail to stop and give way when I (and others) attempt to cross. This happens several times a day
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Again, 6th September
item.description:
This area is cleaned one day and then the pigs who have no interest in their community leave rubbish and household waste outside. Every week this happens. Barnet has been good at removing the rubbish but unfortunately can’t seem to use technology to catch the fly tippers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodhouse Road, Friern Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road markings are very worn, 6th September
item.description:
Yellow box markings are very worn and not particularly visible as the road falls away to the underpass. This is very important as camera monitoring this box is active. The camera position is elevated and so from the camera point it looks obvious but from ground level it is not so visible. I have paid my fine.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed car parked on Calvert close, 6th September
item.description:
Car reg - YY10GHZ, White Audi. This car has been parked on Calvert close for months now and is untaxed. The car doesn’t move during the day but the owner (who doesn’t live on the close) will return every so often (usually at night) drive the car and return it shortly after.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Calvert Close, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak, 6th September
item.description:
There’s water coming up through the road. The drain is also blocked and there’s a large puddle outside no 46 that’s getting bigger. It’s been getting worse all week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Canonbury Park North, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
